notes_translated.fr: Cette couche hypsométrique représente le relief du territoire québécois à l’échelle de 1/20 000. Les courbes de niveau sont extraites des [cartes topographiques à l'échelle de 1/20 000](https://www.donneesquebec.ca/recherche/fr/dataset/cartes-topographiques-a-l-echelle-de-1-20-000). Elles sont généralement à une équidistance de dix mètres et, dans certains cas, elles peuvent varier entre huit et vingt mètres. Cette couche de donnée comprend les courbes de niveau sous forme de lignes et les points cotés sous forme de points et de textes. Chaque fichier couvre une superficie d’environ 250 km2. Le service Web est quant à lui produit à l’aide des données topographiques à l'échelle de 1/20 000 au sud et des données cartographiques de Ressources naturelles Canada (produit CanVec) à l’échelle de 1/50 000 au nord.
notes_translated.en-t-fr:
This hypsometric layer represents the terrain of Quebec's territory on a scale of 1/20,000. The level curves are extracted from [topographic maps at a scale of 1/20,000] (https://www.donneesquebec.ca/recherche/fr/dataset/cartes-topographiques-a-l-echelle-de-1-20-000). They are usually at an equidistance of ten meters and in some cases they can vary between eight and twenty metres. This data layer includes line level curves and points that are quoted as points and text. Each file covers an area of approximately 250 km2. The web service is produced using topographic data at a scale of 1/20,000 to the south and Natural Resources Canada mapping data (CanVec product) at a scale of 1/50,000 to the north.  
  
  **This third party metadata element was translated using an automated translation tool (Amazon Translate).**

notes:
This hypsometric layer represents the terrain of Quebec's territory on a scale of 1/20,000. The level curves are extracted from [topographic maps at a scale of 1/20,000] (https://www.donneesquebec.ca/recherche/fr/dataset/cartes-topographiques-a-l-echelle-de-1-20-000). They are usually at an equidistance of ten meters and in some cases they can vary between eight and twenty metres. This data layer includes line level curves and points that are quoted as points and text. Each file covers an area of approximately 250 km2. The web service is produced using topographic data at a scale of 1/20,000 to the south and Natural Resources Canada mapping data (CanVec product) at a scale of 1/50,000 to the north.  
  
  **This third party metadata element was translated using an automated translation tool (Amazon Translate).**
